data.title: An All Girl’s College-Prep School in Dallas TX.
data.meta_description: The Hockaday School is an independent, college-preparatory day school for girls from PK-12 grades located in Dallas, TX
data.text:
Character is the pursuit of a moral and ethical life; it promotes within us a self-assurance and strength to withstand life’s pressures.

Courtesy is the quality equated with dignity and generosity of spirit; it is our outward expression of respect not only for others, but also for ourselves.

Scholarship is the search for knowledge that brings a wise understanding of a complex world; it fosters in us a creative, discerning, and resourceful mind.

Athletics is the endeavor to lead a healthy, active, and balanced life. It embraces challenges and inspires us to display sportsmanship in both victory and defeat.

Hockaday Welcomes New Faculty and Staff Members

Please join us in welcoming Hockaday’s newest faculty and staff members!

Read More

First Hockaday Olympian To Debut in Paris Olympics

Teal Cohen '17 (second from left) won the Women’s 4X with her crew at the Final Olympic Qualification Regatta in Lucerne, Switzerland in May, and will row at the 2024 Paris Olympics!

Read More

Hockaday Rowers Win National Title

Hockaday Rowing qualified six boats in five events for USRowing's Youth National Championships in May. All five boats advanced to the "A" Final at the four-day Youth Nats Regatta in Florida in June, where the top eight boats race for a National Championship.

Read More

Soccer Player Named Gatorade Texas Player of the Year

Jaden Thomas ’24 was named the 2023-24 Gatorade Texas Girls Soccer Player of the Year! Thomas is the first Gatorade Texas Girls Soccer Player of the Year to be chosen from The Hockaday School.

Read More

Student Wins National Prize in Race Relation

Congratulations to Dithyae Devesh (Class of 2025) who was one of 29 students nationally to win the Princeton Prize in Race Relations, which recognizes and rewards high school students who, through their volunteer activities, have undertaken significant efforts to advance racial equity and understanding in their schools or communities.

Read More

Lacrosse Wins Fourth Straight State Title

Hockaday's Varsity Lacrosse team won the state title for the fourth year in a row, defeating the Frisco Fury on May 12.

Read More

Student Artwork Recognized

Upper School artists were recently recognized for their pieces through a local competition.

Read More

Students Recognized for Scouting Awards

Congratulations to five Upper School students who were recently recognized for their work in scouting!

Read More

Rosalind “Roz” Redfern Grover ’59 Named Life Trustee

The Hockaday School Board of Trustees is pleased to announce that Rosalind “Roz” Redfern Grover ’59 has been elected Life Trustee.

Read More

Students Inducted Into Cum Laude Society

Hockaday inducted members of the Class of 2024 into its Cum Laude Society this spring.

Read More

Publication Wins Gold Crown Award

Congratulations to Vibrato, Hockaday’s resident literary magazine, which recently won the Columbia Scholastic Press Association's Gold Crown Award!

Read More

Dr. Lauren Miskin Named The Ackerman Family Distinguished Teacher

In April, the School received a gift from the Edward and Wilhelmina Ackerman Foundation to endow a sixth distinguished teacher position, The Ackerman Family Distinguished Teacher.

Read More

Lacrosse Wins SPC Title

Hockaday won its third straight — and seventh overall — SPC girls lacrosse crown in April, defeating St. John’s. The Daisies led 13-3 at halftime.

Read More

Lower School Teachers Named Honorary Alums

Tymesia Smaw and Sabrina Kessee were named Hockaday Honorary Alums at the Alumnae Day Luncheon in April.

Read More

Nicole Ginsburg Small '91 Named Hockaday Medal Award Recipient

Each year, the Alumnae Association presents the Hockaday Medal Award to one alumna who embodies Hockaday’s ideals, demonstrates loyalty to and support of the School, and exemplifies Hockaday’s Four Cornerstones of Courtesy, Character, Scholarship, and Athletics.

Read More

Hockaday Debate Places Second in Country

Hockaday's Debate Team competed this spring in the National Debate Coaches Association National Championship.

Read More

Middle School Track and Field Wins Championships

Congratulations to the Middle School Track and Field team, which won the Metroplex Middle School Championships!

Read More

Student Artwork Recognized

Cecilia Chen (Class of 2027) was recognized for her artwork in a national competition.

Read More

Amy Banks Named The Barney Young Distinguished Teacher

Hockaday is proud to announce that Lower School Science Teacher Amy Banks will serve as The Barney Young Distinguished Teacher, effective July 1, 2024.

Read More

Eleven Seniors Sign to Play College Athletics

Eleven members of the Class of 2024 will continue their athletic careers in college, adding to the 76 collegiate student-athletes who have graduated from Hockaday in the past seven years.

Read More
